text: Making the Cake Preheat the oven to 180°C (Celsius).  Measure out all your ingredients correctly.  Using either a wooden spoon, or an electric mixer, stir the butter and sugar until you feel that they are light and fluffy.  Add the eggs a little at a time, beating well after each addition. Use a mixer instead of a wooden spoon, and make sure the mixture doesn't curdle. Sieve the flour into the bowl and carefully fold in using a tablespoon.  Mix in the milk using the wooden spoon. Stir until the mixture is smooth and drops off the spoon easily. Add a small amount of vanilla extract and fold in using the wooden spoon.  Divide the mixture between the paper cases evenly (in the tin).  Bake the cakes in the oven for 15 minutes until they golden brown. Remove from the oven and place them on a cooling rack to cool completely. Making the Icing Sieve the icing sugar into the bowl.  Add the lemon juice and stir with a mixer with the warm water. Mix until thick and smooth. Add food color into the icing, mix well.Spoon the icing onto the cakes. Spread the icing evenly.Use your imagination to decorate. Finished.
